comments.commentBody: First Flynn, now Sessions (assuming the allegation that he perjured himself stands up). Turns out being a friend of Russia is as good a career move now as it was in the 70s.
Are there any gold prison cells?

replies.commentBody: Actually, Sessions has been asked to recuse himself by two GOP members (shocking!) -- since he wouldn't have had the gumption to do it himself.

The Swamp Creatures. In charge of cleaning it.

They should ALL resign! Every. Last. One.

comments.commentBody: Let me get this straight. Attorney General Sessions is going to investigate charges that Senator Sessions spoke to the Russians twice during the campaign and lied to congress about it ? While his former communications chief is now a chief advisor to President Trump ? You know, the guy who stated that "the powers of the President will not be questioned." What a swamp.
Too little too late. The USA is now the Union of Soviet America with Trumputin as president. Our congress can now be called the Doom-us.

replies.commentBody:
This was not an election, Mr. Campbell. It was a FINANCIAL COUP against democracy in America by The Con Don and his Top 1% Global Financial Elite Robber Baron/ Radical Religion Good Old Boys' Party - they think they BOUGHT IT.

Have WE got some bad news for them. They are a tiny minority and This Will NOT Stand in America. Not now. Not Ever Again.

There is a difference, friend. When you met those guys from Iran at a party you were, presumably, not a government official. Nor were you a government official testifying under oath while being vetted for a cabinet level position. At present, we have an outrageous situation where -- a scant six weeks into a new administration -- one top presidential advisor has already been fired for lying about his contacts with Russian government officials, while another has just been caught in another lie about his contacts with the Russian ambassador to the United States while serving as an advisor to the present president's campaign. There's too much 'smoke' hanging around the Trump administration for all of them to keep denying there's no 'fire' to go along with it.

If I were a Republican I think I would be demanding a special investigator be appointed at present. What will Republicans gain by continuing to hitch their wagon to an inept, inefficient, bungling, ethically compromised administrative 'star'?

comments.commentBody:
Nothing new here. Same previously run NYT story, same old slanderous innuendo and hearsay designed to prejudice the public against our president. So, somebody might have met somebody, nobody knows what was said, but hey! they might have said something, and nobody goes on the record?! Utter nothingness.

I met some guys from Iran at a party once, does that make me a spy?

This might be a good opportunity to remind readers of Obama's hot mic moment with Russia. Check it out... https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XsFR8DbSRQE

The difference is Obama's hot mic moment is NOT hearsay, it is a matter of record. Think about it. Get over it. Trump won the election.

I don't like the way the headline is worded "Obama Administration rushed to preserve".   Such choice of phrasing implies, to me, that intelligence officials did something underhanded when in fact time was running short even as new intel was being unveiled daily.   Why not: "Crunched for Time, Obama Administration Worked Hard to Protect & Preserve Intelligence on Russian Election Hacking

I keep thinking I'm stuck in some kind of Orwellian version of Carroll's down the hole world. A world where a pathological liar brands critical information fake and his own fakery, gospel. Where the beltway punditry gushes that he's being presidential because he went an entire hour without disparaging someone's character and most of the lies were only banal. Down here, the boy king's regent is a white nationaliist and the chief law enforcement agent in the nation is one Jeffery Beauregard Sessions, a throwback white separatist from the Heart of Dixie and we're scratching our heads at how it could be possible their
constituents are inspired to desecrate Jewish cemetaries and murder Indian immigrants.
I know It's only make believe though.

replies.commentBody:
According to information I heard on MSNBC last night, Democrats are going to use a law from the 1920s to force the IRS to give them The Con Don's tax returns since the 1990s.

The truth will come out and it needs to be RIGHT NOW - before the Robber Barons can put their evil plans to destroy America to work.
Lock him up, lock him up, lock him up, lock him up, lock him up, lock him up, lock him up, lock him up, lock him up...

Yes, there is such a law.

But the Dems (in their minority status) can't invoke it.

For the R's to do so would signal that they felt they needed to drastically separate themselves from Donald in order to save their seat in th next Congressional election.

I don't sense that most R's feel that it is in their personal. private best interest to throw Donald under the bus..................YET.

comments.commentBody: I'd like to see those taxes now Mr. Trump.

Great. We now have a liar and bigot as Attorney General that puts himself above the law. Does this mean that the rest of our society can now lie under oath? As an attorney doesn't he understand the importance of truthfulness when under oath? Given the affinity of Trump and his leadership team for whoppers and Alternate Facts, clearly Jeff Sessions will fit right in.
Given the level of contact here, meet and greets with the Russian Ambassador to the US, it is not possible that there are no such contacts with Hillary's Senate surrogates.

replies.commentBody: But it's too little too late. He should have held the committee to investigate this while he was President, before a single vote was cast. In fairness, he didn't want to appear too political and Hillary looked unbeatable. But we now know differently. He tried to redeem himself after the election realizing what would happen by disseminating this information. Again, not brilliant, but the best option that late in the game.
Obama had to protect his sources. It was smart and necessary to stay quiet -- and gather more information.
O.K, but you can't sway voters that aren't listening.

comments.commentBody:
Obama was brilliant to spread around the intelligence.

Do you really expect the truth from a Republican led intelligence committee investigation based on the F.B.I. that helped elect Trump reports to that committee and an F.B.I. answerable to AG Sessions, also a hand picked Republican overseen by Republican Trump?

This is just like Watergate in that the AG Sessions took part in the initial campaign and has control over the F.B.I. and the Director who publically swayed the voters away from Clinton just a few days before voting.

C'mon.........there will be no truth in a public investigation. If anything I anticipate a finding by the committee that there was no Russian interference.

Then Wham, out comes the truth from well hidden multiple places.

Bravo Obama. You were too shy about your brilliance. Great Check Mate.

Read Emily Bazelon's piece from The Magazine a week or so ago to give further context to the role Sessions, Bannon and Miller, a truly deadly trio, played in the Trump campaign and earlier as they pursued their mission to disrupt and destroy our democracy. It reminds me of the cabal that manipulated the govenment into the Iraq war, avoiding all the normal routes of planning and discussion in order to make their grotesque dream for the country come true. And now we see that caper again.

Scary that the safeguards of our democracy can be avoided and/or so distorted bya small group of people with harmful agendas of their own, like getting Trump elected with the help of the Russians and the Sessions/Bannon master plan.

replies.commentBody: How about lying to Congress? That's a crime.

comments.commentBody: Don't think the Russians had anything in making Hillary Clinton the worst candidate in modern American history.  Richard Nixon could have beaten her in his present state.  Constantly amazes me the excuses of the Dems, there is any laws broken so be it, but not seeing any evidence so far.

replies.commentBody:
Vox, I applaud your sentiment. But I doubt we can convict Donald of lying on the matter of what his campaign staff did or did not do.

We would have to capture him lying about a provable personal role he had in this.

If Flynn/Sessions/etc asked for Donald's OK to try to do a deal with the Russans and we can demonstrate that, then we have him.

If Donald was regularly briefed by folks in the campaign on their dealings with officials of the Russian government, and we can prove it, then we have him.

But if we find out that ManafortStone/Bannon/Flynn/Sessions had discussions with Russians during the campaign, Donald can simply maintain that he didn't know.

To get the basis for action against Donald, we need very specific and personal evidence.

My hunch is that such evidence exists, but we will need to scramble to get it before it is all shredded, erased or otherwise destroyed.

comments.commentBody:
"Then and now, Mr. Trump has denied that his campaign had any contact with Russian officials"?

ANOTHER blatant lie?

When's the investigation begin? Let's start by making Trump testify UNDER OATH. As soon as he blatantly perjures himself, remove him from office.

This is NOT a partisan issue! A hostile foreign power fiddles with US election results, and Trump and various and sundry of his minions has contact with them at the time! Treason, anyone?

So if the US Attorney General lied to Congress and the American people regarding his contacts with Russian government officials, shouldn't he recuse himself from all legal matters that come before the Justice Department? What right does he have to be the "law and order" prosecutor for the rest of us?

I'm sorry NYT, but where is the news here? We need hard facts, not suspicions. We need clarity about this issue, not more questions. "All spoke on the condition of anonymity because they were discussing classified information, nearly all of which remains secret, making an independent public assessment of the competing Obama and Trump administration claims impossible." That should say it all. No source and no information.

The press is going to need another guide such as deep throat from the Nixon Watergate scandal.  It's clear from this article and past reporting Trumps associates including Jeff Sessions who lied having had contact with the Russians.  Yes lied.  One would only wonder why the Russians were in the Cleveland area during the GOP convention in the first place.  Doesn't that seem odd to you?  Hello?

The more the White House and Republicans in Congress stonewall investigating the Trump administration's Russia ties, the more the president dismisses Russia as "a ruse," the more suspicious I get.

If they were so certain the evidence would be exculpatory, why not welcome a thorough, independent investigation and prove the lying media - especially the failing New York Times - wrong?

No, they're more afraid of the truth. And that's why this story must be pursued as vigorously as possible.
The Russians must have been celebrating to a frenzy. Their deepest mole turns out to be the president of The United States of America.
Feels very Nixonesque to me.

Obama's actions to preserve evidence is as heroic as Session's behavior is dubious and cowardly. History will judge this patriot - Obama - very favorably, unlike his counterpart. As far as Sessions goes, one down and 3 to go:Bannon, Miller, Trump.

Isn't it strange that Michael Flynn couldn't remember what he discussed with the Russians as he lied to the VP until he faced confronting the transcripts of his contacts.  Will it be the same with Sessions who lied during his confirmation hearings for Attorney General.  Not only should Sessions recuse himself from the investigations he should resign.  He never should have been confirmed in the first place, thanks to Mitch McConnell telling Elizabeth Warren to essentially shut up and sit down.  And now, we are asked to rake republicans at their word?  Time to clean up Trump's mess.
Wow.  Where there's smoke there's fire....but we knew that.  Fake News -I think not.

replies.commentBody: Absolutely. Perfectly spoken. Needs to be understood by everyone.
What evidence of impropriety has been presented? all hearsay....

comments.commentBody:
So, Sessions and Trump Aides can meet with a government which is actively hacking DNC emails to help swing an American election one way, and that is met with a yawn by the right...but Bill Clinton bumps into and chats with a former friend, and cons and Repubs go ballistic?

Another of too many examples where the right wing explodes over a much more minor "offense" when it's a Democrat and then smirks at a far worse infraction by their own side.

This, to me, is the problem. The GOP is not protectionist of America. It is protectionist of the GOP, and bellicose toward the Democrats.

This banana-republic, dictator-wannabe will stop at nothing to undermine this constitutionally elected administration that threatens to undo his legacy of more government and more regulation. I think the word "preserve" in your headline is incorrect... the correct word is concoct.
